intro: Leptochilus leveillei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant flower colors, which range from white to pink and purple.
